description.narrative: The project seeks to increase the quality of Cambodia’s cassava production, to improve processing and transformation techniques, to raise the standards of Cambodia’s cassava exporters and their products to meet existing and new market requirements.

participating-org.narrative: Enhanced Integrated Framework for Trade related Technical Assistance to LDCs Trust Fund manager

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: Enhanced Integrated Framework for Trade related Technical Assistance to LDCs Trust Fund manager

description.narrative: 1. Availability of an updated cassava value chain study 2. No. of association(s) of cassava exporters, processors and producers formulated to engage in policy dialogue, to find markets and to disseminate agricultural techniques for their members 3. Availability of public information in Khmer language on cassava export procedure and market access plan/strategy 4. No. of orientation/training on export procedure to cassava exporters/processors 5. Availability of capacity development plan for cassava associations 6. No. of potential international market for Cambodia's cassava export established 7. No. of training, knowledge sharing events, and exchange visits (as part of the implementation of the associations' capacity development plan) 8. Availability of knowledge product/research related to agriculture/cassava sector i.e. the environmental impact of cassava industry, contract farming models, etc. 9. Availability of draft national cassava policy or strategy

comment.narrative: 1. The latest value Chain study was produced in 2007 by Trade Promotion Department, Ministry of Commerce 2. There is no cassava associations established in targeted areas 3. There is no public information available in Khmer language on export procedure and requirements 4. There is no specific training on export procedure for cassava association 5. There is no cassava associations in the targeted areas, hence no capacity development plan. 6. There is no connection with potential market, under UNDP support. 7. Limited exposure of the national stakeholder to understand about the regional dynamic of cassava sector 8. Limited knowledge product/research related to agriculture/cassava sector and there is no environmental impact of cassava industry and cassava contract farming models available yet. 9. No national cassava policy or strategy in place.

1. Updated cassava value chain produced, and the recommendations are followed up 2. 8 cassava associations formulated and actively engage at policy level on cassava related topics. 3 Export Guidebook and Market Penetration Strategy developed 4. One orientation on export procedures. 5. Capacity development plan of cassava associations developed. 6. Three blocks of potential export markets identified and at least one market linked. 7. At least one training, knowledge sharing event, and exchange visit (as part of the implementation of the associations capacity development plan) 8. Study on environmental impact of cassava industry, and contract farming produced 9.Final draft of cassava sector policy produced and endorsed at technical level by all relevant stakeholders

1. Update value chain study produced (achieved in 2016), and the recommendations e.g. transshipment issues, trade facilitation at cross-border checkpoints, and support on the cassava policy formulation were implemented and addressed by the Ministry of Commerce (achieved in 2017) 2. 8 cassava associations were formulated (achieve in 2016). And the cassava associations are recognized as one of the key stakeholders in the development of the National Cassava policy/strategy. What is more, based on the project’s experiences and good practices, a Cassava Association Development Strategy was developed and circulated by the Ministry of Commerce to other cassava associations in Cambodia and to Government’s ministries (achieved in 2017) 3 The Export Guidebook and Market Penetration Strategy for Cambodia Cassava were produced (achieved in 2017)
4. Two orientation on export procedure, standard requirement, and export rules provided to exporters and processor (one in 2016, one in 2017) 5. Capacity assessment for the cassava associations was conducted and the capacity development plan was produced (achieved in 2016).
6. Three blocks of potential export markets identified: 1. India and Bangladesh; 2. Indonesia and Malaysia; 3. United Kingdoms, and Germany). A potential market (India) was linked with the suppliers in Cambodia (achieved in 2017)
7. Cambodia’s cassava associations have been continuing to improve their technical skills and to strengthen their networks with other countries’ cassava associations: an exchange knowledge workshop with cassava associations in Thailand; three trainings on integration of SMEs in global value chain, on environmental impact of cassava farming and production, and SPS provided to members of the Cambodia’s associations were included in every cassava related technical trainings provided by the project e.g. market information, SPS, and access to cassava market etc. (achieved in 2017) 8. Environmental Impact Assessment on cassava processing was drafted (achieved in 2016). Rapid assessment/study on contract farming modalities in Cambodia produced. Importantly, a private company committed to test the identified contract farming modality for organic cassava production in Preah Vihea province, as a result of an exchange knowledge study tour for cassava processors and farmers to learn from the practice of contract farming in Cambodia’s rice sector (achieved in 2017) 9.In July 2018, the final draft of cassava sector policy produced and endorsed by all relevant stakeholders in Q2 2018, and submitted to MoC team for them to process further to the next step of endorsement (achieve in 2018)
NA - the project completed all its activities, and was closed in Q4 2018
NA - the project completed all its activities, and was closed in Q4 2018
